alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Owsley, northern Leslie, northwestern Perry, southwestern Breathitt and northeastern Clay Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whoopflarea, or 13 miles southeast of Booneville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Buckhorn, Saul and Dalesburg around 550 PM EDT. Buckhorn Lake S.P., Gays Creek, Shoal, Beech, Kaliopi and Crockettsville around 555 PM EDT. Krypton, Mosley Bend, Confluence, Chavies, Barwick, Toulouse, Bush Branch, Altro, Dryhill and Wolf Coal around 600 PM EDT. Lamont and Avawam around 605 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hazard, Dice, Ned, Bulan, Diablock and Rowdy. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway near mile marker 32, and between mile markers 42 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
